title: Create the Gapminder dataset
text:
# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

# Print the first 3 rows of the DataFrame
print(gapminder_df.head(3))

       country continent  year  life_expectancy  population_millions  \
0  Afghanistan      Asia  1952           28.801             8.425333   
1  Afghanistan      Asia  1957           30.332             9.240934   
2  Afghanistan      Asia  1962           31.997            10.267083   

   gdp_per_capita

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text:
This page explores the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita. We analyze data from 142 countries over several decades to see how economic prosperity impacts lifespan.
import pandas as pd import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text:
This page explores the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita. We analyze data from 142 countries over several decades to see how economic prosperity impacts lifespan.
import pandas as pd import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

title: Country Analysis
text:
This page examines trends in life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population for a selected country over time.
import pandas as pd import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
gapminder = pd.read_csv(“gapminder.csv”)
country = “United States” country_data = gapminder[gapminder[“country”] == country]
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6)) plt.plot(country_data[“year”], country_data[“life_expectancy”], label=“Life Expectancy”, marker=“o”) plt.plot(country_data[“year”], country_data[“gdp_per_capita”], label=“GDP per Capita”, marker=“s”) plt.plot(country_data[“year”], country_data[“population_millions”], label=“Population”, marker=“^”)
plt.xlabel(“Year”) plt.ylabel(“Value”) plt.title(f”Trends in {country}: Life Expectancy, GDP per Capita, and Population”) plt.legend() plt.show()

title: Country Analysis

title: Gapminder Analysis
text:
Welcome to the Gapminder dataset analysis. This dataset contains information on life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population across 142 countries from 1952 to 2007.

Pages:

Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
Life Expectancy and Population
Country Analysis

title: Life Expectancy and Population
text:
This page explores how life expectancy varies with population size across different countries and years.
import pandas as pd import seaborn as sns import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
gapminder = pd.read_csv(“gapminder.csv”)
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6)) sns.scatterplot(data=gapminder, x=“population_millions”, y=“life_expectancy”, hue=“year”, alpha=0.6) plt.xscale(“log”) plt.xlabel(“Population (millions, log scale)”) plt.ylabel(“Life Expectancy”) plt.title(“Life Expectancy vs Population”) plt.show()

text:
